intro: Microtis eremicola, commonly known as the desert microtis, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes orchids, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces pale yellow or greenish-white blooms. Microtis eremicola is often found in coastal dunes and is an important component of the local flora in its habitat.
